newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria c.bank cuts main interest rate to 5.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria c.bank cuts main interest rate to 5.2 pct.

text.p: The Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) cut its main interest rate to 5.2 pct monthly from 6.2 pct, dealers said on Thursday.
The new main rate becomes effective on Monday, May 12.

"The central bank informed us that it had decided to cut the main rate to 5.2 percent monthly or 64.20 percent annually," a commercial bank dealer told Reuters. The central bank itself declined to comment.
The cut was in line with the falling yield on one- and four-week discount T-bills auctioned daily by the Finance ministry from Friday through Thursday, the dealer said.

Under a $657 million funding agreement with the International Monetary Fund the BNB adjusts the rate weekly to the weighted average effective monthly yield on one- and four-week discount T-bills auctioned in five successive days.
The new, lower main interest rate reflected a projected fall in consumer price inflation to four to five percent monthly in April from 12.3 percent in March.
Inflation figure for April was expected to be released by the National Statistics Institute this week.
The effective monthly yield on one-week discount T-bills has been falling from 5.69 percent at last Friday's auction to 3.65 percent at today's auction.
The effective monthly yield on four-week discount T-bills also eased gradually to 5.14 percent today from 5.62 percent on May 2. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 911 88
